topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Dr. Fei-Fei Li, her role in AI’s resurgence, and frames the episode’s focus: AI history, human impact, and the next frontier (world models).

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Figma Make and Justworks.

topics.title: Human-centered AI optimism and responsibility
topics.summary: Fei-Fei explains her “humanist” stance: AI’s impact is real but shaped by human choices; technology is a double-edged sword requiring responsibility at every stage of development and deployment.

topics.title: AI’s evolution: from early AI to machine learning
topics.summary: Fei-Fei gives a concise history from Turing and Dartmouth through expert systems to the rise of statistical machine learning, setting the stage for modern deep learning.

topics.title: ImageNet: big data as the missing ingredient
topics.summary: She recounts the motivation and construction of ImageNet (millions of labeled images, 22k concepts) and how it enabled the 2012 AlexNet breakthrough using GPUs—cementing the data+compute+neural nets recipe.

topics.title: AI as a “dirty word” to mainstream branding
topics.summary: They discuss how, as recently as 2015–2017, some companies avoided the term “AI,” and how quickly the branding flipped to “everyone is an AI company.”

topics.title: AGI skepticism and limits of current systems
topics.summary: Fei-Fei questions the usefulness of “AGI” as a scientific term, argues we’re far from human-level general intelligence, and highlights gaps in reasoning, abstraction, perception, and emotional intelligence.

topics.title: Why world models are the next frontier
topics.summary: She explains why language models are inspiring but insufficient for embodied understanding; world models/spatial intelligence are positioned as the bridge between vision, action, and robotics, motivating the founding of World Labs.

topics.title: World models’ applications: design, science, creativity
topics.summary: They explore how world models could power robots, games, and creative tools, and Fei-Fei adds examples like architecture/design and scientific discovery (e.g., spatial reasoning in DNA structure discovery).

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message for Sinch and RCS messaging.

topics.title: Robotics and the “bitter lesson” constraints
topics.summary: Fei-Fei explains Sutton’s “bitter lesson” (scale wins) and why robotics is harder: data/action mismatch, scarcity of action-labeled 3D interaction data, and the physical productization challenges akin to (and harder than) self-driving cars.

topics.title: Awe at human intelligence and energy efficiency
topics.summary: They reflect on how difficult it is to replicate basic embodied capabilities and how AI research increases appreciation for the brain’s efficiency and robustness.

topics.title: Marble launch: prompt-to-3D worlds product
topics.summary: Fei-Fei introduces Marble, built on World Labs’ generative 3D world model, describing the technical milestone (navigable 3D worlds from prompts) and early product decisions like the “dot” visualization for user delight.

topics.title: Early Marble use cases and learning from users
topics.summary: They discuss initial applications: virtual production/VFX (major time savings), game development, robotic simulation via synthetic environments, and unexpected research uses like psychology experiments and exposure therapy scenarios.
